intro: Microchilus herzogii, commonly known as the Herzog's microchilus, is a rare and small flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its inflorescence consists of small yellow to orange flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
